snippet.title: Powerhouse Museum to move to Parramatta
snippet.content: Sydney's iconic Powerhouse Museum is officially moving west, with the state government set to announce a new site on the banks of the Parramatta River. The new, bigger facility will sit on the old David Jones carpark, across the river from Riverside Theatres, under a $140 million deal with Parramatta Council to secure the site. There will only be a small presence left at Ultimo near the CBD, which will not be part of the Powerhouse Museum, News Corp Australia reports. The relocation promised by former premier Mike Baird in 2014 is expected to cost up to $1 billion. Premier Gladys Berejiklian will on Monday join Arts Minister Don Harwin at the new location to announce details of the move. (C) AAP 2017
